ruling_headline: National surveys show Ted Cruz isn't beating Hillary Clinton in poll after poll after poll
statement: "Poll after poll after poll shows me beating Hillary."

ruling_headline: John Kasich's super PAC slams Ted Cruz for TV ad Cruz's campaign didn't make
statement: "Many just call him 'Lyin' Ted.' ... His TV ad about John Kasich? Lie! Stations had to pull it off the air."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump has no evidence that Ted Cruz was responsible for naked Melania ad
statement: Says Ted Cruz distributed the ad showing a nude Melania Trump on a rug.

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz wrongly says Ukraine gave up nukes due to American security guarantees
statement: "Ukraine voluntarily gave up its nuclear weapons because the United States of America" said it would "ensure (its) territorial integrity from Russia."

statement_context: an interview with NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz pins too much blame for outflow of jobs on Barack Obama
statement: Says President Barack Obama has "been presiding over our jobs going overseas for seven years."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says he's engaged civilly with protesters at his campaign events
statement: "More than once, I've actually had a conversation with the protesters on substance."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz: 'I always opposed the TPP (Trans-Pacific Partnership)'
statement: "I opposed TPP (Trans-Pacific Partnership) and have always opposed TPP."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Detroit
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says Donald Trump wrote 10 checks to Hillary Clinton campaigns
statement: Says Donald Trump has written 10 checks to Hillary Clinton "and four of those checks were not to her Senate campaign. … It was to her presidential campaign."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Detroit
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says Donald Trump wrote 10 checks to Hillary Clinton campaigns
statement: Says Donald Trump has written 10 checks to Hillary Clinton "and four of those checks were not to her Senate campaign. … It was to her presidential campaign."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz wrongly says Harry Reid likes Donald Trump best in GOP field
statement: Says "Harry Reid, when asked about the Republican field, said the Republican he likes the best is Donald Trump, and he said, because I can work with him. He'll cut deals."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz wrongly says Harry Reid likes Donald Trump best in GOP field
statement: Says "Harry Reid, when asked about the Republican field, said the Republican he likes the best is Donald Trump, and he said, because I can work with him. He'll cut deals."

ruling_headline: Yes, Donald Trump has been linked to the mob
statement: "There have been multiple media reports about (Donald Trump's) business dealings with the mob, with the mafia."

statement_context: the Republican debate in Houston, Texas
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz twists Donald Trump's talk about health care, 'socialized' medicine
statement: "A couple of debates ago, (Donald Trump) said if you don’t support socialized health care, you’re heartless."

ruling_headline: Do Republicans think Donald Trump is the right candidate to beat Hillary Clinton?
statement: "About 70 percent of Republicans nationwide ... don't think Donald Trump is the right guy" to take on Hillary Clinton in November.

ruling_headline: Cruz wrongly says Trump's only Supreme Court pick is his sister, a 'hardcore pro-abortion liberal'
statement: Says "the one person (Donald Trump) has suggested that would make a good justice is his sister, who is a court of appeals judge appointed by Bill Clinton. She is a hardcore pro-abortion liberal judge."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz overstates Supreme Court nomination 'tradition'
statement: "It has been 80 years since a Supreme Court vacancy was nominated and confirmed in an election year. There is a long tradition that you don't do this in an election year."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz falsely says campaign simply 'forwarded' CNN's report on Ben Carson
statement: Says CNN reported Ben Carson was "taking a break from campaigning" and the Cruz campaign "forwarded that news to our volunteers."

statement_context: a town hall in Henniker, N.H.
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz off on claim that median African-American income rose $5,000 under Reagan
statement: "During eight years under Ronald Reagan, African-American median income rose by about $5,000."

statement_context: a town hall event in Windham, N.H.
ruling_headline: Cruz repeats False attack about immigration bill letting Syrians in U.S. without background checks
statement: The 2013 immigration bill "expanded President Obama’s ability to bring Syrian refugees to this country without mandating any meaningful background checks."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz's false claim that Trump, Clinton and Sanders 'have the identical position on health care'
statement: "Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders have the identical position on health care, which is they want to put the government in charge of you and your doctor."

statement_context: comments during the Iowa Republican presidential debate
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz's Pants on Fire claim that health care law is nation's 'biggest job-killer'
statement: Obamacare "is the biggest job-killer in this country -- millions of Americans have lost their jobs, have been forced into part-time work."

statement_context: comments during the Iowa Republican presidential debate
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz said he never insulted Donald Trump. The record suggests otherwise
statement: "I have not insulted Donald personally."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says Barack Obama 'dramatically degraded our military'
statement: "Barack Obama, right now, No. 1, over seven years has dramatically degraded our military."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in North Charleston, S.C.
ruling_headline: Rubio mischaracterizes Cruz's statement on birthright citizenship
statement: Says Sen. Ted Cruz used to be "in favor of birthright citizenship" but is now against it.

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in North Charleston, S.C.
ruling_headline: Cruz is right in back-and-forth with Rubio about vote on defense spending
statement: Says Marco Rubio "knows full well I voted for his amendment to increase military spending to $697 billion."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in North Charleston, S.C.
ruling_headline: Did former Attorney General Eric Holder say he viewed his mission as 'brainwashing' against guns?
statement: Says President Barack Obama "appointed Eric Holder as attorney general. Eric Holder said he viewed his mission as brainwashing the American people against guns."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in North Charleston, S.C.
ruling_headline: Did former Attorney General Eric Holder say he viewed his mission as 'brainwashing' against guns?
statement: Says President Barack Obama "appointed Eric Holder as attorney general. Eric Holder said he viewed his mission as brainwashing the American people against guns."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says U.S. has 'lowest percentage of Americans working today of any year since 1977'
statement: "We have the lowest percentage of Americans working today of any year since 1977."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Las Vegas
ruling_headline: Cruz muddles accusation against Rubio's 2013 immigration bill
statement: "One of the most troubling aspects of the Rubio-Schumer Gang of Eight bill was that it gave President Obama blanket authority to admit refugees, including Syrian refugees, without mandating any background checks whatsoever."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Las Vegas
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz misfires on definition of 'carpet bombing' in GOP debate
statement: Says carpet bombing means bombing "not a city, but the location of the troops," with "embedded special forces to direct the air power."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz's claim that the head of the FBI told Congress 'they cannot vet those refugees' from Syria
statement: "The head of the FBI has told Congress they cannot vet those (Syrian) refugees."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz misquotes CIA official, makes false claim on bombing ISIS oil and climate change
statement: "Mike Morell testified and told Congress that the reason Obama has not bombed ISIS' oil fields is they're concerned about global warming."

statement_context: a post on her campaign website
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton's exaggerated claim that Ted Cruz 'tried to ban contraception' five times
statement: "Ted Cruz tried to ban contraception" five times.

statement_context: a radio interview with Hugh Hewitt
ruling_headline: Are the 'overwhelming majority of violent criminals' Democrats? Ted Cruz said so
statement: "Here’s the simple and undeniable fact: The overwhelming majority of violent criminals are Democrats."

statement_context: the Republican presidential debate in Milwaukee, Wis.
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says U.S. tax code has more words than the Bible
statement: "There are more words in the IRS code than there are in the Bible."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Boulder, Colo.
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says median wage for women has dropped $733 under Obama
statement: "Under Barack Obama and the big government economy, the median wage for women has dropped $733."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's 'Meet the Press'
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says GOP leadership 'took the lead confirming Loretta Lynch as attorney general'
statement: "Republican leadership took the lead confirming Loretta Lynch as attorney general."

statement_context: an interview with CBS' Stephen Colbert
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says slow economic growth under Jimmy Carter, Barack Obama stands apart
statement: "When (Ronald) Reagan came in, from 1978 to 1982, economic growth averaged less than 1 percent a year. There’s only one other four-year period where that’s true. That’s true from 2008 to 2012."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz: most GOP candidates 'publicly embraced amnesty'
statement: "A majority of the men and women on this stage have previously and publicly embraced amnesty. I am the only candidate on this stage who has never supported amnesty."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says deal will 'facilitate and accelerate' Iran getting a nuclear bomb
statement: "The Iran Deal will facilitate and accelerate the nation of Iran acquiring nuclear weapons."

statement_context: in comments at a GOP debate in Cleveland
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz: most GOP candidates 'have supported amnesty'
statement: "A majority of the candidates on this stage have supported amnesty ... I have never supported amnesty."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz changed position on Trade Promotion Authority, also called fast-track
statement: On support for Trade Promotion Authority, called fast-track

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says Supreme Court on same-sex marriage is out of step with public, but polls don’t agree
statement: The Supreme Court’s views "are radically out of step with public opinion" regarding its decision to legalize same-sex marriage nationwide.

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz: Small business are going out of business 'in record numbers'
statement: "Small businesses (are) going out of business in record numbers."

statement_context: an interview on "Late Night with Seth Meyers"
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz's world's on fire, but not for the last 17 years
statement: "Many of the alarmists on global warming, they’ve got a problem because the science doesn’t back them up. In particular, satellite data demonstrate for the last 17 years, there’s been zero warming."

statement_context: an interview on CNN's "State of the Union"
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says 92 million Americans aren't working
statement: "92 million Americans aren't working."

statement_context: comments on CNN's "State of the Union"
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says Obama refuses to directly arm Kurds in ISIS fight
statement: "The Obama administration is refusing to directly arm the Kurds."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says in 2014 elections, voters made clear their opposition to Obamacare, 'amnesty'
statement: In the 2014 elections, "the American people overwhelmingly said we don't want Obamacare … and we don't want amnesty."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz: Net neutrality regulations put government in charge of Internet prices, services
statement: Says Obama's net neutrality proposal "puts the government in charge of determining Internet pricing, terms of service and what types of products and services can be delivered."

ruling_headline: Cruz: Obama's surgeon general pick is not a 'health professional'
statement: "Obama, instead of nominating a health professional, he nominated someone who is an anti-gun activist (for surgeon general)."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says SNL's Lorne Michaels could be jailed under Democratic-backed amendment
statement: Saturday Night Live executive producer "Lorne Michaels could be put in jail under this amendment for making fun of any politician."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz: 'U.S. policy has changed, now we make deals with terrorists'
statement: Says Barack Obama broke a decades-old policy of "not negotiating with terrorists."

statement_context: a speech at the CPAC conference
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says Barack Obama is first president 'who thinks he can choose which laws to enforce and which laws to ignore'
statement: Says President Barack Obama "is the first president we've ever had who thinks he can choose which laws to enforce and which laws to ignore."

statement_context: an interview on CBS' "Face the Nation"
ruling_headline: Labor force participation is at lowest point since 1978, says Texas Sen. Ted Cruz
statement: Under President Barack Obama, "We’ve got the lowest labor force participation in over three decades, since 1978."

statement_context: in an interview on the "Tonight Show"
ruling_headline: Sen. Ted Cruz says gun prosecutions down under Obama administration
statement: "Under President (George W.) Bush, prosecution of gun crimes was 30 percent higher than it is under President Obama."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "The Tonight Show with Jay Leno"
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says U.S. has averaged 0.9 percent growth over past four years
statement: "In the last four years, our economy has grown on average 0.9 percent a year."

ruling_headline: Sen. Ted Cruz says premiums have gone 'up and up and up' for 'virtually every person'
statement: "Virtually every person across this country has seen premiums going up and up and up" due to Obamacare.

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says 'a strong bipartisan majority' in the House of Representatives 'voted to defund Obamacare'
statement: "A strong bipartisan majority" in the House of Representatives "voted to defund Obamacare."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says policy change by UPS left employees’ spouses “without health insurance”
statement: UPS left 15,000 employees’ spouses "without health insurance" and told them to, "go on an exchange with no employer subsidy."

statement_context: a speech to the Family Leadership Summit in Ames, Iowa
ruling_headline: Sen. Ted Cruz says Obama 'just granted all of Congress an exception' to Obamacare
statement: Says "President Obama just granted all of Congress an exception" to Obamacare.

ruling_headline: Senate bill has immediate legalization but border security that's 'designed never to come into being,' says Cruz
statement: The Senate immigration bill "has immediate legalization ... and the border security is sometime in the future, and just like in 1986, it's designed never to come into being."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says expanding Medicaid will "worsen health care options for the most vulnerable"
statement: "Expanding Medicaid will worsen health care options for the most vulnerable among us in Texas."

ruling_headline: Sen. Ted Cruz says the federal government thinks it has ‘authority to regulate our toilet seats’
statement: "We have a federal government that thinks they have the authority to regulate our toilet seats."

ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says health reform’s price tag has doubled
statement: "Did you know ObamaCare will cost nearly twice as much as initially expected -- $1.8 TRILLION?"
